The minimal number of turns \(H\) to reach position \((0, 9)\) from the initial position \((0, 0)\) at turn \(t_1 = 8\), while avoiding collisions with cars on freeways \(y = 1\) to \(y = 8\), is 11. This is achieved by staying at \(y = 0\) for the first turn to avoid the unsafe condition on row \(y = 1\) at turn 9, then moving up consistently to reach \(y = 9\) by turn 18.

### Explanation:
- At turn 8, the player is at \(y = 0\), which is safe (not a freeway). Choosing action \(S\) (stay) keeps the player at \(y = 0\) for turn 9, avoiding collision on row \(y = 1\) at turn 9 (unsafe due to car coverage).
- From turn 9 onwards, moving up (\(U\)) each turn reaches \(y = 9\) at turn 18:
  - Turn 9: \(y = 0 \to y = 1\) (safe, as row \(y = 1\) is unsafe only at turns 8 and 9; turn 10 is safe).
  - Turns 10–17: Continue moving up, reaching \(y = 9\) at turn 18. All intermediate rows are safe at the respective turns:
    - Rows \(y = 1\) to \(y = 4\) are unsafe only at turns 8 and 9; turns 10 onwards are safe.
    - Rows \(y = 5\) to \(y = 8\) are unsafe only at turns 10 and 11; turns 12 onwards are safe.
- At turn 18, the player is at \(y = 9\) (goal), and action \(S\) is chosen (arbitrary, as position is already reached).

### Action Sequence:
The sequence of actions \(\{a_t\}\) for turns \(t = 8\) to \(t = 18\) (i.e., \(t_1 + t\) for \(t = 0\) to \(10\)) is:

\boxed{ \begin{array}{c} \text{Turn } 8: S \\ \text{Turn } 9: U \\ \text{Turn } 10: U \\ \text{Turn } 11: U \\ \text{Turn } 12: U \\ \text{Turn } 13: U \\ \text{Turn } 14: U \\ \text{Turn } 15: U \\ \text{Turn } 16: U \\ \text{Turn } 17: U \\ \text{Turn } 18: S \end{array} }

To reach position (0, 9) from the initial position (0, 0) at turn \(t_1 = 9\) while avoiding collisions with cars on freeways \(y = 1\) to \(y = 8\), the minimal number of turns \(H\) is 17. This is determined by the requirement to avoid being on any freeway (y = 1 to 8) at turns where \(\delta t = 7\) and \(\delta t = 8\) (i.e., turns 16 and 17), as all freeways are unsafe at these times due to car positions covering \(x = 0\). 

The strategy involves:
- Staying at \(y = 0\) for the first 8 actions (turns 9 to 16) to avoid freeways during unsafe times.
- Then moving up directly to \(y = 9\) with 9 consecutive "U" actions (turns 17 to 25).

This sequence ensures that:
- At turns 16 and 17 (\(\delta t = 7\) and \(\delta t = 8\)), the player is at \(y = 0\), which is safe (no freeway).
- From turn 18 onward (\(\delta t \geq 9\)), all freeways are safe, and moving up sequentially visits each freeway at safe times.

The action sequence is as follows:

\boxed{ \begin{array}{c} \text{Turn } 9: S \\ \text{Turn } 10: S \\ \text{Turn } 11: S \\ \text{Turn } 12: S \\ \text{Turn } 13: S \\ \text{Turn } 14: S \\ \text{Turn } 15: S \\ \text{Turn } 16: S \\ \text{Turn } 17: U \\ \text{Turn } 18: U \\ \text{Turn } 19: U \\ \text{Turn } 20: U \\ \text{Turn } 21: U \\ \text{Turn } 22: U \\ \text{Turn } 23: U \\ \text{Turn } 24: U \\ \text{Turn } 25: U \end{array} }

After the action at turn 25, the player reaches (0, 9) at turn 26.

\boxed{17}

To reach position (0, 9) from the initial position (0, 2) at turn \(t_1 = 11\) while avoiding collisions with cars on freeways \(y = 1\) to \(y = 8\), the minimal number of turns required is \(H = 15\). This sequence ensures that the player is not on any freeway \(y = 1\) to \(y = 8\) at times \(\tau = 5\) and \(\tau = 6\) (relative to \(t_1 = 11\), so turns 16 and 17), when all these freeways are unsafe due to car spans covering position \(x = 0\). The player moves down to \(y = 0\) by turn 13 and stays there until turn 17 to avoid the unsafe times, then moves up directly to \(y = 9\).

The action sequence is as follows:

- **Turn 11**: Action \(D\) (move down to \(y = 1\) at turn 12).  
  At turn 11, \(y = 2\) (freeway 2), which is safe at \(\tau = 0\) (since freeways 1-4 are safe except at \(\tau = 5,6\)).
- **Turn 12**: Action \(D\) (move down to \(y = 0\) at turn 13).  
  At turn 12, \(y = 1\) (freeway 1), safe at \(\tau = 1\).
- **Turn 13**: Action \(S\) (stay at \(y = 0\) for turn 14).  
  \(y = 0\) is always safe (no cars).
- **Turn 14**: Action \(S\) (stay at \(y = 0\) for turn 15).  
  \(y = 0\) safe.
- **Turn 15**: Action \(S\) (stay at \(y = 0\) for turn 16).  
  \(y = 0\) safe.
- **Turn 16**: Action \(S\) (stay at \(y = 0\) for turn 17).  
  At turn 16 (\(\tau = 5\)), \(y = 0\) avoids collision (freeways 1-8 unsafe).
- **Turn 17**: Action \(U\) (move up to \(y = 1\) at turn 18).  
  At turn 17 (\(\tau = 6\)), \(y = 0\) avoids collision. Freeways 1-8 unsafe, but \(y = 0\) safe.
- **Turn 18**: Action \(U\) (move up to \(y = 2\) at turn 19).  
  At turn 18 (\(\tau = 7\)), \(y = 1\) (freeway 1) safe (freeways 1-4 safe for \(\tau \geq 7\)).
- **Turn 19**: Action \(U\) (move up to \(y = 3\) at turn 20).  
  At turn 19 (\(\tau = 8\)), \(y = 2\) (freeway 2) safe.
- **Turn 20**: Action \(U\) (move up to \(y = 4\) at turn 21).  
  At turn 20 (\(\tau = 9\)), \(y = 3\) (freeway 3) safe.
- **Turn 21**: Action \(U\) (move up to \(y = 5\) at turn 22).  
  At turn 21 (\(\tau = 10\)), \(y = 4\) (freeway 4) safe.
- **Turn 22**: Action \(U\) (move up to \(y = 6\) at turn 23).  
  At turn 22 (\(\tau = 11\)), \(y = 5\) (freeway 5) safe (freeways 5-8 unsafe only at \(\tau = 0,5,6\)).
- **Turn 23**: Action \(U\) (move up to \(y = 7\) at turn 24).  
  At turn 23 (\(\tau = 12\)), \(y = 6\) (freeway 6) safe.
- **Turn 24**: Action \(U\) (move up to \(y = 8\) at turn 25).  
  At turn 24 (\(\tau = 13\)), \(y = 7\) (freeway 7) safe.
- **Turn 25**: Action \(U\) (move up to \(y = 9\) at turn 26).  
  At turn 25 (\(\tau = 14\)), \(y = 8\) (freeway 8) safe.

After 15 actions (turns 11 to 25), the player reaches (0, 9) at turn 26. This sequence minimizes \(H\) while avoiding all collisions, as verified by the car span positions at each relevant turn.

The minimal number of turns \(H\) to reach \((0, 9)\) from the initial position \((0, 2)\) at turn \(t_1 = 13\) is 13. This sequence avoids collisions with cars on freeways \(y = 1\) to \(y = 8\) by ensuring the player is at \(y = 0\) (a safe position with no cars) during turns 16 and 17, when collisions would otherwise occur on any freeway \(y = 1\) to \(y = 8\).

- At turns 16 and 17 (\(\Delta T = 3\) and \(\Delta T = 4\) from \(t_1 = 13\)), the car with initial span \((-18, -29)\) covers \(x = 0\) for all freeways \(y = 1\) to \(y = 8\), leading to a collision if the player is on any of these freeways.
- The player must be at \(y = 0\) or \(y = 9\) at turns 16 and 17 to avoid collision. However, reaching \(y = 9\) by turn 17 is impossible from \(y = 2\) in the available turns (maximum \(y_{16} = 5\) and \(y_{17} \leq 1\)), so \(y = 0\) is the only feasible safe position.
- From turn 13 to turn 16, actions are chosen to reach \(y_{16} = 0\) without violating \(y \geq 0\).
- At turn 17, \(y_{17} = 0\) is maintained with a stay action (S), as moving would risk collision or invalid position.
- After turn 17, no collision risk exists, so the player moves up (U) every turn to reach \(y = 9\) at turn 26 (after action \(a_{25}\)).

The sequence of actions \(\{a_t\}_{t=13}^{25}\) is:

- **Turn 13: S** (stay, \(y_{14} = 2\))
- **Turn 14: D** (down, \(y_{15} = 1\))
- **Turn 15: D** (down, \(y_{16} = 0\))
- **Turn 16: S** (stay, \(y_{17} = 0\)) – safe at \(y = 0\)
- **Turn 17: U** (up, \(y_{18} = 1\))
- **Turn 18: U** (up, \(y_{19} = 2\))
- **Turn 19: U** (up, \(y_{20} = 3\))
- **Turn 20: U** (up, \(y_{21} = 4\))
- **Turn 21: U** (up, \(y_{22} = 5\))
- **Turn 22: U** (up, \(y_{23} = 6\))
- **Turn 23: U** (up, \(y_{24} = 7\))
- **Turn 24: U** (up, \(y_{25} = 8\))
- **Turn 25: U** (up, \(y_{26} = 9\)) – goal reached

This sequence achieves \(y_{26} = 9\) in \(H = 13\) actions, the minimum possible given the constraints.

\boxed{ \begin{array}{c} \text{Turn } 13: \text{ S} \\ \text{Turn } 14: \text{ D} \\ \text{Turn } 15: \text{ D} \\ \text{Turn } 16: \text{ S} \\ \text{Turn } 17: \text{ U} \\ \text{Turn } 18: \text{ U} \\ \text{Turn } 19: \text{ U} \\ \text{Turn } 20: \text{ U} \\ \text{Turn } 21: \text{ U} \\ \text{Turn } 22: \text{ U} \\ \text{Turn } 23: \text{ U} \\ \text{Turn } 24: \text{ U} \\ \text{Turn } 25: \text{ U} \end{array} }

To reach position (0, 9) from the initial position (0, 2) at turn \(t_1 = 14\) while avoiding collisions with cars on freeways \(y = 1\) to \(y = 8\), the minimal number of turns \(H\) is 12. The sequence of actions must ensure the player is not on any freeway (\(y = 1\) to \(8\)) at turns 16 and 17, as cars cover \(x = 0\) on all freeways at these times, causing collisions. The only safe positions at turns 16 and 17 are \(y = 0\) or \(y = 9\), but \(y = 9\) is unreachable by turn 17 from the starting position. Thus, the player must be at \(y = 0\) at both turns 16 and 17.

Starting from \(y = 2\) at turn 14:
- At turn 14, moving down (\(D\)) to \(y = 1\) at turn 15.
- At turn 15, moving down (\(D\)) to \(y = 0\) at turn 16.
- At turn 16, staying (\(S\)) to remain at \(y = 0\) at turn 17.

After turn 17, there are no collision risks, as cars do not cover \(x = 0\) for \(T \geq 18\). From \(y = 0\) at turn 17, moving up (\(U\)) repeatedly for 9 turns reaches \(y = 9\) at turn 26.

The sequence of actions for turns \(t_1\) to \(t_1 + H - 1 = 14\) to \(25\) is:
- \(a_{14} = D\): Move down to \(y = 1\).
- \(a_{15} = D\): Move down to \(y = 0\).
- \(a_{16} = S\): Stay to remain at \(y = 0\).
- \(a_{17} = U\): Move up to \(y = 1\).
- \(a_{18} = U\): Move up to \(y = 2\).
- \(a_{19} = U\): Move up to \(y = 3\).
- \(a_{20} = U\): Move up to \(y = 4\).
- \(a_{21} = U\): Move up to \(y = 5\).
- \(a_{22} = U\): Move up to \(y = 6\).
- \(a_{23} = U\): Move up to \(y = 7\).
- \(a_{24} = U\): Move up to \(y = 8\).
- \(a_{25} = U\): Move up to \(y = 9\).

This sequence achieves \(y = 9\) at turn 26 (after 12 actions) with no collisions:
- At turns 14 and 15, the player is on freeways but no cars cover \(x = 0\).
- At turns 16 and 17, the player is at \(y = 0\), safe from collisions.
- For turns 18 to 25, the player is on freeways, but no cars cover \(x = 0\) for \(T \geq 18\).

No shorter sequence is possible, as the detour to \(y = 0\) is necessary to avoid collisions at turns 16 and 17, and 9 up moves are required from \(y = 0\) to \(y = 9\).

This sequence avoids collisions with cars on freeways \(y = 1\) to \(y = 8\) by ensuring the player is not on rows 5-8 at turns 23 and 24 (\(\delta = 3\) and \(\delta = 4\)), when these rows are unsafe, and not on rows 1-4 at turns 27 and 28 (\(\delta = 7\) and \(\delta = 8\)), though the latter is not an issue in this sequence as the player is on higher rows by then.

The sequence of actions is:
- Stay at row 3 for turns 20 and 21 to avoid moving into unsafe rows prematurely.
- Move up to row 4 at turn 22.
- Stay at row 4 at turn 23 to avoid rows 5-8 at the unsafe turn 23.
- Stay at row 4 at turn 24 to avoid rows 5-8 at the unsafe turn 24.
- From turn 25 onwards, move up each turn to reach row 9 efficiently, as rows 5-8 are safe after turn 24.

The actions and resulting positions are:

|------|--------|-----------------------|-----------------------------|-------|
| 20   | S      | (0, 3)               | δ=0, row 3 safe (unsafe only at δ=7,8) | Stay at row 3. |
| 21   | S      | (0, 3)               | δ=1, row 3 safe            | Stay at row 3. |
| 22   | U      | (0, 4)               | δ=2, row 4 safe (unsafe only at δ=7,8) | Move to row 4. |
| 23   | S      | (0, 4)               | δ=3, row 4 safe            | Stay at row 4 to avoid rows 5-8 unsafe at δ=3. |
| 24   | U      | (0, 5)               | δ=4, row 5 unsafe? **But action moves to row 5 at turn 25, position checked at turn 24 is row 4.** | At turn 24, position is row 4 (safe). Action U moves to row 5 at turn 25. |
| 25   | U      | (0, 6)               | δ=5, row 6 safe (rows 5-8 unsafe only at δ=3,4) | Safe to move up. |
| 26   | U      | (0, 7)               | δ=6, row 7 safe            | Safe to move up. |
| 27   | U      | (0, 8)               | δ=7, row 8 safe (rows 1-4 unsafe at δ=7, but row 8 safe) | Safe to move up. |
| 28   | U      | (0, 9)               | δ=8, row 9 safe (no cars)  | Reach goal. |

- **Turn 24 clarification**: At turn 24, the player is at row 4 (safe, as δ=4 and row 4 is unsafe only at δ=7,8). The action U moves the player to row 5 at turn 25. Since row 5 is unsafe at δ=4, but the player is not on row 5 until turn 25 (δ=5), which is safe, no collision occurs.
- **Unsafe times**:

To reach position (0, 9) from the initial position (0, 3) at turn \(t_1 = 21\) in the minimal number of turns \(H\) while avoiding collisions with cars on freeways \(y = 1\) to \(y = 8\), the following sequence of actions is determined. The cars on each freeway move right with speed 6, and collision occurs only if the player is on a freeway \(y\) at turn \(T\) and 0 is within the span of any car on that freeway at that turn.

### Analysis of Unsafe Times for Each Freeway
- **Freeways \(y = 1, 2, 3, 4\)**:  
  - Cars: \((30, 19, \text{right}, 6)\) and \((-36, -47, \text{right}, 6)\).  
  - Unsafe when \(0 \in \text{Span}(T)\) for the second car at turns \(T = 6\) and \(T = 7\) relative to \(t_1\).  
  - Safe at all other times.

- **Freeways \(y = 5, 6, 7, 8\)**:  
  - Cars: \((30, 19, \text{right}, 6)\), \((-48, -59, \text{right}, 6)\), and \((-12, -23, \text{right}, 6)\).  
  - Unsafe when \(0 \in \text{Span}(T)\):  
    - For car \((-12, -23, \text{right}, 6)\) at turns \(T = 2\) and \(T = 3\).  
    - For car \((-48, -59, \text{right}, 6)\) at turns \(T = 8\) and \(T = 9\).  
  - Safe at all other times.

- **Freeways \(y = 0\) and \(y = 9\)**: Always safe (no cars).

### Path to Minimize Turns
- Start at \(y = 3\) at turn \(t_1 = 21\) (relative time \(t = 0\)).  
- To reach \(y = 9\) in minimal turns, avoid being on unsafe freeways at unsafe times:  
  - Avoid \(y = 5\) at \(t = 2\) and \(t = 3\) (relative).  
  - Avoid \(y = 1, 2, 3, 4\) at \(t = 6\) and \(t = 7\).  
  - Avoid \(y = 5, 6, 7, 8\) at \(t = 8\) and \(t = 9\).  
- The minimal \(H\) is 9, achieved by:  
  - Moving up to \(y = 4\) at turn 22 (\(t = 1\)).  
  - Staying at \(y = 4\) for turns 22 and 23 (\(t = 1\) and \(t = 2\)) to avoid \(y = 5\) at \(t = 2\) and \(t = 3\).  
  - Moving up directly from \(y = 4\) to \(y = 9\) from turn 24 to 28 (\(t = 3\) to \(t = 7\)), reaching \(y = 9\) at turn 29 (\(t = 8\)).  
- At turn 29 (\(t = 8\)), the position is \(y = 9\), and action \(S\) is applied to stay at \(y = 9\).

### Action Sequence
The sequence of actions for turns \(t_1 = 21\) to \(t_1 + H - 1 = 21 + 9 - 1 = 29\) is:

- Turn 21: \(U\) (move up to \(y = 4\) at turn 22)  
- Turn 22: \(S\) (stay at \(y = 4\))  
- Turn 23: \(S\) (stay at \(y = 4\))  
- Turn 24: \(U\) (move up to \(y = 5\) at turn 25)  
- Turn 25: \(U\) (move up to \(y = 6\) at turn 26)  
- Turn 26: \(U\) (move up to \(y = 7\) at turn 27)  
- Turn 27: \(U\) (move up to \(y = 8\) at turn 28)  
- Turn 28: \(U\) (move up to \(y = 9\) at turn 29)  
- Turn 29: \(S\) (stay at \(y = 9\))

### Verification
- **Collision avoidance**:  
  - At \(t = 2\) and \(t = 3\) (turns 23 and 24), player is at \(y = 4\), which is safe for \(y = 4\) at these times.  
  - At \(t = 6\) and \(t = 7\) (turns 27 and 28), player is at \(y = 7\) and \(y = 8\), which are safe for \(y = 7\) and \(y = 8\) at these times (unsafe only at \(t = 2, 3, 8, 9\)).  
  - At \(t = 8\) (turn 29), player is at \(y = 9\), which is always safe.  
- **Position at turn 29**: \(y = 9\), as required.

This sequence achieves the goal in \(H = 9\) turns, which is minimal, as it is impossible to reach \(y = 9\) by turn 28 (relative \(t = 7\)) due to the need to avoid \(y = 5\) at \(t = 2\) and \(t = 3\).

The goal is to reach position (0, 9) from the initial position (0, 4) at turn \(t_1 = 22\) in the minimal number of turns \(H\), avoiding collisions with cars on freeways \(y = 1\) to \(y = 8\).

### Analysis of Unsafe Times
- Freeways 1 to 4 are unsafe at turns \(T = 27\) and \(T = 28\) due to cars covering \(x = 0\).
- Freeways 5 to 8 are unsafe at turns \(T = 23\), \(T = 24\), \(T = 29\), and \(T = 30\) due to cars covering \(x = 0\).
- At all other times, the freeways are safe.
- Positions \(y = 0\) and \(y = 9\) have no cars and are always safe.

### Strategy
- The player starts at \(y = 4\) at turn \(T = 22\), which is safe for freeway 4.
- Turns \(T = 23\) and \(T = 24\) are unsafe for freeways 5 to 8, so the player must avoid being on \(y = 5\) to \(8\) at these times.
- To avoid collision, the player stays at \(y = 4\) for turns \(T = 23\) and \(T = 24\) by choosing the "S" (stay) action at turns 22 and 23.
- After \(T = 24\), the player moves up ("U") each turn to reach \(y = 9\) as quickly as possible, as freeways 5 to 8 are safe from \(T = 25\) to \(T = 28\) (except \(T = 29\) and \(T = 30\), but the player reaches \(y = 9\) before then).

### Sequence of Actions (Minimal \(H = 7\))
- **Turn 22 (current turn)**: Start at \(y = 4\). Action "S" keeps the player at \(y = 4\) for turn 23, avoiding freeways 5-8 at \(T = 23\).
- **Turn 23**: At \(y = 4\) (safe). Action "S" keeps the player at \(y = 4\) for turn 24, avoiding freeways 5-8 at \(T = 24\).
- **Turn 24**: At \(y = 4\) (safe). Action "U" moves to \(y = 5\) for turn 25. Freeway 5 is safe at \(T = 25\).
- **Turn 25**: At \(y = 5\) (safe). Action "U" moves to \(y = 6\) for turn 26. Freeway 6 is safe at \(T = 26\).
- **Turn 26**: At \(y = 6\) (safe). Action "U" moves to \(y = 7\) for turn 27. Freeway 7 is safe at \(T = 27\).
- **Turn 27**: At \(y = 7\) (safe). Action "U" moves to \(y = 8\) for turn 28. Freeway 8 is safe at \(T = 28\).
- **Turn 28**: At \(y = 8\) (safe). Action "U" moves to \(y = 9\) for turn 29, reaching the goal safely.

### Verification
- Collision is checked at each turn based on the player's \(y\)-position and car spans at that turn:
  - Turn 22: \(y = 4\), freeway 4 safe (not unsafe at \(T = 22\)).
  - Turn 23: \(y = 4\), freeway 4 safe (not unsafe at \(T = 23\)).
  - Turn 24: \(y = 4\), freeway 4 safe (not unsafe at \(T = 24\)).
  - Turn 25: \(y = 5\), freeway 5 safe (not unsafe at \(T = 25\)).
  - Turn 26: \(y = 6\), freeway 6 safe (not unsafe at \(T = 26\)).
  - Turn 27: \(y = 7\), freeway 7 safe (not unsafe at \(T = 27\)).
  - Turn 28: \(y = 8\), freeway 8 safe (not unsafe at \(T = 28\)).
- The player reaches \(y = 9\) at turn 29, which is safe with no cars.

This sequence achieves the goal in \(H = 7\) actions, which is minimal because:
- A direct path upward in 5 actions (turns 22 to 26) would collide at turns 23 or 24.
- Paths with fewer than 7 actions (e.g., 6 actions) cannot reach \(y = 9\) by turn 28 without colliding or failing to increase \(y\) sufficiently.

### Analysis of Car Occupancy
The cars on freeways \(y = 1\) to \(y = 4\) are identical and unsafe (i.e., a collision occurs if the player is on the freeway) at times \(t = 4\) and \(t = 5\) (where \(t\) is the time offset from \(t_1\), so \(t = T - t_1\)).  
The cars on freeways \(y = 5\) to \(y = 8\) are identical and unsafe at times \(t = 0, 1, 6, 7\).

- **Freeways \(y = 1, 2, 3, 4\)**: Unsafe at \(t = 4, 5\) (safe at all other times).
- **Freeways \(y = 5, 6, 7, 8\)**: Unsafe at \(t = 0, 1, 6, 7\) (safe at all other times).

The player starts at \(y = 4\) at \(t = 0\) (turn 23). To reach \(y = 9\) (which is not a freeway and always safe), the player must pass through freeways \(y = 5\) to \(y = 8\). The minimal number of turns \(H\) is determined as follows:
- A direct upward path with 5 up actions would require positions: \(y_{23} = 4\), \(y_{24} = 5\), \(y_{25} = 6\), \(y_{26} = 7\), \(y_{27} = 8\), \(y_{28} = 9\). However, at \(t = 1\) (turn 24), \(y = 5\) is unsafe, leading to a collision. Thus, \(H = 5\) is impossible.
- With \(H = 6\), the player can start by staying at \(y = 4\) for one turn to avoid being on \(y = 5\) at \(t = 1\). The sequence is:
  - \(t = 0\) (turn 23): \(y = 4\) (safe), action Stay (S) → \(y_{24} = 4\).
  - \(t = 1\) (turn 24): \(y = 4\) (safe), action Up (U) → \(y_{25} = 5\).
  - \(t = 2\) (turn 25): \(y = 5\) (safe, as \(t = 2\) not unsafe for \(y = 5\)), action U → \(y_{26} = 6\).
  - \(t = 3\) (turn 26): \(y = 6\) (safe, as \(t = 3\) not unsafe for \(y = 6\)), action U → \(y_{27} = 7\).
  - \(t = 4\) (turn 27): \(y = 7\) (safe, as \(t = 4\) not unsafe for \(y = 7\)), action U → \(y_{28} = 8\).
  - \(t = 5\) (turn 28): \(y = 8\) (safe, as \(t = 5\) not unsafe for \(y = 8\)), action U → \(y_{29} = 9\).
- At \(t = 6\) (turn 29), \(y = 9\) is reached safely. No collisions occur, as all positions during the sequence are safe at their respective times.

This path achieves the goal in \(H = 6\) turns, which is minimal since \(H = 5\) is impossible.

The player starts at position (0, 7) at turn \(t_1 = 27\). The goal is to reach (0, 9) in the minimal number of turns \(H\) while avoiding collisions with cars on freeways \(y = 1\) to \(y = 8\).

### Analysis
- From the initial position \(y = 7\), reaching \(y = 9\) requires at least two upward moves (U actions), as each action changes the vertical position by at most 1.
- With \(H = 2\), the position at turn \(t_1 + H - 1 = 27 + 2 - 1 = 28\) must be 9. However, from \(y_{27} = 7\), after one action, \(y_{28}\) can be at most 8 (with U), so \(y_{28} = 9\) is impossible. Thus, \(H = 2\) is infeasible.
- The minimal \(H\) is 3, meaning the position at turn \(t_1 + H - 1 = 27 + 3 - 1 = 29\) should be 9. This can be achieved with two upward moves: U at turn 27 to reach \(y_{28} = 8\), and U at turn 28 to reach \(y_{29} = 9\).
- Collision avoidance:
  - At turn 27, the player is on freeway \(y = 7\). The cars on freeway 7 (and identically on freeway 8, as per the car state) are:
    - Car A: \((-48, -59, \text{right}, 6)\), covers \(x=0\) at \(\Delta t = 8, 9\) (turns 35, 36)
    - Car B: \((-12, -23, \text{right}, 6)\), covers \(x=0\) at \(\Delta t = 2, 3\) (turns 29, 30)
    - Car C: \((24, 13, \text{right}, 6)\), never covers \(x=0\)
  - At turn 27 (\(\Delta t = 0\)):
    - Car A: min = \(-59 + 6 \cdot 0 = -59\), max = \(-48 + 6 \cdot 0 = -48\), span \([-59, -48]\), 0 not in span
    - Car B: min = \(-23 + 6 \cdot 0 = -23\), max = \(-12 + 6 \cdot 0 = -12\), span \([-23, -12]\), 0 not in span
    - No collision on \(y = 7\).
  - At turn 28 (\(\Delta t = 1\)):
    - Player moves to \(y = 8\) (via U at turn 27), so position is now on freeway \(y = 8\).
    - Cars on \(y = 8\) (same as \(y = 7\)):
      - Car A: min = \(-59 + 6 \cdot 1 = -53\), max = \(-48 + 6 \cdot 1 = -42\), span \([-53, -42]\), 0 not in span
      - Car B: min = \(-23 + 6 \cdot 1 = -17\), max = \(-12 + 6 \cdot 1 = -6\), span \([-17, -6]\), 0 not in span
      - Car C: min = \(13 + 6 \cdot 1 = 19\), max = \(24 + 6 \cdot 1 = 30\), span \([19, 30]\), 0 not in span
    - No collision on \(y = 8\).
- At turn 29, the player is at \(y = 9\), which has no cars and is safe.
- The action at turn 29 is set to S (stay) since \(y = 9\) is the goal and moving up would attempt to go to \(y = 10\), which is invalid; S keeps the position at 9 safely.

### Sequence
- \(H = 3\) (actions at turns 27, 28, and 29).
- Actions:
  - Turn 27: U (move up to \(y = 8\))
  - Turn 28: U (move up to \(y = 9\))
  - Turn 29: S (stay at \(y = 9\))

This sequence reaches (0, 9) at turn 29 with no collisions, and \(H = 3\) is minimal.

At turn 28, the player is on freeway y = 8. The cars on y = 8 at turn 28 are:
- Car 1: span [-53, -42] (head = -42, tail = -53, direction = right, speed = 6)
- Car 2: span [-17, -6] (head = -6, tail = -17, direction = right, speed = 6)
- Car 3: span [19, 30] (head = 30, tail = 19, direction = right, speed = 6)

Position 0 is not in any of these spans, so no collision occurs at turn 28.

To reach y = 9, the player can move up (action U) at turn 28. This results in y_{29} = 8 + 1 = 9 at turn 29.

At turn 29, the player is on y = 9, which is not a freeway (freeways are y = 1 to 8), so there are no cars and no collision risk. The position (0, 9) is reached at turn 29.

The minimal number of turns H is 2, as y_{t_1 + H - 1} = y_{28 + 2 - 1} = y_{29} = 9.

The sequence of actions is:
- At turn 28: action U to move to y = 9 at turn 29.
- At turn 29: action S to stay at y = 9 (since the position is already reached, but an action must be specified; S is chosen as it maintains the position).

No other sequence can achieve the goal in fewer turns, as H = 1 would leave the player at y = 8 at turn 28, not y = 9.
